content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of `extract_julia_code`:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Parse the markdown string into blocks
    parsed = parse_markdown(md)

    # Loop over all blocks, search for code blocks and concatenate their content
    code_content = ""
    for block in parsed.content
        if isa(block, CodeBlock) && endswith(block.language, "julia")
            code_content *= join([block.code[i] for i in 1:length(block.code)]; "\n")
        end
    end

    # Return the concatenated content as a string
    return code_content
end
```
This function first parses the markdown to obtain its structure of blocks (lists, code blocks etc.). It then checks each block and if it is a Julia code block, it concatenates its content with newline character. 

Please note that this function assumes that your markdown document uses 'Julia' as the programming language for the code blocks. If you have different conventions, this function will need adjustments.
